alert.note: Alert for City of Chesapeake; City of Norfolk; City of Portsmouth; City of Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 21 at 2:07PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occuring. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Virginia, including the following independent cities, City of Chesapeake, City of Norfolk, City of Portsmouth and City of Virginia Beach. * WHEN...Until 400 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 204 PM EDT, the public reported heavy rain and minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Virginia Beach, Downtown Norfolk, Downtown Portsmouth, Old Dominion University, Norfolk State University, Churchland, Ocean View, Virginia Wesleyan University, Regent University, Norfolk, Chesapeake, Portsmouth, Suffolk, Ghent, Norview, Cradock, Norfolk NAS, Norfolk International, Western Branch and Bowers Hill. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: City of Chesapeake; City of Norfolk; City of Portsmouth; City of Virginia Beach
